True Grit: A Resilience Library for Clojure Developers

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

True Grit is a data-driven, functionally-oriented, idiomatic Clojure library designed for circuit breakers, bulkheads, retries, rate limiters, and timeouts. It serves as a wrapper library for Resilience4j, one of the top resilience Java libraries.

For developers working with network services, True Grit provides a convenient way to handle function failures. By wrapping functions that call out to underlying network services, developers can set timeouts, limit the number of calls per time period, retry failed functions, track failure rates, and implement bulkheads to reserve capacity and partition usage.

The library offers an easy-to-use interface, allowing developers to attach resilience policies to functions using the net.modulolotus.truegrit namespace. Additionally, True Grit provides all-in-one functions that take a function and a configuration map, returning a wrapped function with the resilience policy attached.

True Grit is stable and actively maintained, with bug fixes and updates to Resilience4j being the only planned future work. Developers can find documentation for True Grit here.

To use True Grit in your Clojure project, simply add the following to your Leiningen project.clj or deps.edn file:

; Leiningen
[truegrit "version"]

; deps.edn
{truegrit {:mvn/version "version"}}

True Grit is a valuable tool for Clojure developers who want to enhance the resilience of their applications. By leveraging the power of Resilience4j, True Grit simplifies the implementation of circuit breakers, retries, rate limiters, and other resilience patterns.
